messages.title: Low wages, housing shortages, crowded schools/hospitals, are not caused by immigration, they are failures of government policy.
messages.content: Natalie Bennett, Leader of the Green Party (England and Wales).

messages.title: Stop the cuts in Shropshire
messages.content: Our conservative Shropshire Council is already making around £40 million cuts to services for vulnerable adults, children's services, youth services and waste management. Their final target is £80 million in cuts, and, unbelievably, these cuts include services for the most vulnerable group of all, children in the care of Shropshire Council.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: What kind of NHS do we want?
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Green Party is totally committed to a publicly owned, managed and staffed NHS that is free at point of use, meets local needs and is well run. We do not accept the privatisation of clinical services and we do not accept a reduction in the range of facilities available in the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital. We also support the development and strengthening of community hospitals.

issues.health: The Green Party is totally committed to a publicly owned, managed and staffed NHS that is free at point of use, meets local needs and is well run.
issues.immigration: Low wages, housing shortages, crowded schools/hospitals, are not caused by immigration, they are failures of government policy.

leaflet.personalStatement: A former educational psychologist, Janet spent 27 years working in Shropshire on behalf of children with special needs and children in care.

contactInformation.address: South Shropshire Green Party, 22 Corve Street, Ludlow, SY8 1DA
